sn10.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rajagaha on Mount Indra’s Peak, the haunt of the native spirit Indaka.
sn10.1:4.3: Then the native spirit Indaka went up to the Buddha,
sn10.1:5.1: “The Buddhas say that form is not the soul.
sn10.1:5.2: Then how does this body manifest?
sn10.1:5.3: Where do the bones and liver come from?
sn10.1:5.4: And how does one cling on in the womb?”
sn10.1:6.2: from there a little bud appears;
sn10.1:6.3: next it becomes a lump of flesh;
sn10.1:6.5: From that swelling the limbs appear,
sn10.1:6.6: the head hair, body hair, and teeth.
sn10.1:7.2: the food and drink that she consumes—
sn10.1:7.4: the person in the mother’s womb.”
